channel.title: CyberNetSec - Industrial Control Systems
channel.description: Latest industrial control systems threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Anubis Ransomware Hits Australian Engineering Firm Aussie Fluid Power
item.description:
The Australian industrial engineering company, Aussie Fluid Power, has confirmed it was hit by a ransomware attack claimed by the emerging 'Anubis' ransomware group. The incident, which has impacted company operations and stakeholder data, aligns with warnings from the Australian Cyber Security Cent...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Industrial Control Systems, Cyberattack

item.title: CISA Issues 13 Advisories for Critical ICS/OT Vulnerabilities
item.description:
On October 16, 2025, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) released a significant batch of thirteen advisories for vulnerabilities affecting Industrial Control Systems (ICS). These alerts impact widely used Operational Technology (OT) products from major vendors including ...

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Patch Management

item.title: Full Industrial Control: Two CVSS 10.0 Flaws Found in Red Lion ICS RTUs
item.description:
Security researchers have discovered and disclosed two critical vulnerabilities, both rated CVSS 10.0, in Red Lion Sixnet series industrial remote terminal units (RTUs). The flaws, CVE-2023-42770 (authentication bypass) and CVE-2023-40151 (remote code execution), can be chained together. An unauthen...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Humiliation for Pro-Russian Hackers 'TwoNet' After Attacking Decoy Water Utility Honeypot
item.description:
The pro-Russian hacktivist group **TwoNet** has been publicly embarrassed after cybersecurity firm **[Forescout](https://www.forescout.com/)** revealed the group was duped into attacking a sophisticated decoy system. In September, TwoNet boasted on Telegram about disrupting a Dutch water utility's c...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Threat Actor, Industrial Control Systems, Threat Intelligence

item.title: Expert Advice on Securing Critical Infrastructure with Limited Budgets
item.description:
In a recent podcast, cybersecurity expert Chetrice Romero from Ice Miller provided guidance for leaders responsible for protecting critical infrastructure, particularly those facing limited budgets. item.title: Jaguar Land Rover Begins Phased Restart a Month After Crippling Cyberattack
item.description:
On October 7, 2025, Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) announced it is beginning a phased restart of its manufacturing plants, more than a month after a major cyberattack on August 31 halted its global operations. The attack disrupted everything from production lines and parts flow to retail systems. The resta...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Incident Response, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: CISA Warns of Widespread Flaws in Industrial Control Systems from Major Vendors
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has released a series of advisories warning of numerous vulnerabilities in Industrial Control Systems (ICS) from prominent vendors, including Rockwell Automation, Hitachi Energy, Mitsubishi Electric, and Delta Electronics. These flaws ...

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Regulatory

item.title: Chinese APT Flax Typhoon Weaponizes ArcGIS Server as Persistent Backdoor in Year-Long Spy Campaign
item.description:
The China-linked threat group Flax Typhoon (also known as Ethereal Panda) conducted a sophisticated, year-long espionage campaign against a government agency by compromising an Esri ArcGIS server. According to researchers at ReliaQuest, the attackers modified a legitimate Java server object extensio...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: Qilin Ransomware Cripples Asahi Breweries, Demands $10 Million Ransom
item.description:
The Qilin ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a devastating cyberattack against Asahi Group Holdings, one of Japan's largest beverage companies. The attack, which occurred in late September, forced the company to halt production at 30 factories and suspend shipments, leading to significa...

Severity: High
